children.subject: I haven't taken CS 188 (only 189) but I think the biggest reason that CS 70 is a prerequisite for 189 is the probability component -- especially continuous probability, which I don't believe is covered in Math 55. I would not recommend taking 189 without a course covering continuous probability -- that class is already hard enough as it is! And I don't really think the topics in Math 55 (discrete math, combinatorics, discrete probability) have too much applicability in 189 (they probably won't hurt though). If you'd like to take a course that covers probability without having to relearn the discrete math component of Math 55, perhaps consider EECS 126!

history.content:
Strongly recommend you take eecs 126/ prob 140 before, but prereqs aren't enforced 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I took 55 and 134 and plan to take 189 in spring 2021. After viewing Shewchuk's course material, I would say that 55 is definitely not enough. I absorb 134 materials well and find that 140 and 126 are better prepare for 189

Strongly recommend you take eecs 126/ prob 140 before, but prereqs aren't enforced 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I took 55 and 134 and plan to take 189 in spring 2021. After viewing Shewchuk's cource material, I would say that 55 is definitely not enough. I absorb 134 materials well and find that 140 and 126 are better prepare for 189
Strongly recommend you take eecs 126/ prob 140 before, but prereqs aren't enforced

children.subject: When I took CS 70, it probably used only one lecture to go over the continuous distribution lol
I don't think it matters, the continuous distribution in CS 70 was just changing the notations from sum to integral, and 189 doesn't use any of the fancy tricks taught in 134.
I remember Sahai saying EECS 126 was the recommended class for going into ML research
As a CS major, would you recommend 126 or 140 for 189 preparation/ML research, etc?

history.content:
Hello! 

I am an Applied Math major so I took Math 55, but did not take CS70. I have now decided on a Data Science cluster so I was wondering if I can take CS188/189 without CS70 (a prerequisite), but only having takenMath 55 instead. Is CS70 a hard-enforced prerequisite or would knowledge from Math 55 suffice?
history.subject: CS 188/189 without CS70 but with Math 55
